question: [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/lib.rs] [Struct: IndexerGrpcFileCheckerConfig] [Input validation] Can an attacker provide empty strings for existing_bucket_name or new_bucket_name during configuration, causing the checker to access invalid or attacker-controlled buckets without validation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/lib.rs] [Struct: IndexerGrpcFileCheckerConfig] [Integer overflow] Can an attacker set starting_version to u64::MAX, causing integer overflow when the version is incremented by 1000 in processor.rs line 94, potentially skipping critical transaction verification? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/lib.rs] [Function: run()] [Error handling] Does the .expect() call on line 37 expose sensitive error information that could leak bucket configurations or internal state to attackers monitoring logs? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/lib.rs] [Function: run()] [Panic-based DoS] Can an attacker trigger a panic in processor.run() that causes the entire file checker service to crash permanently via the .expect() call, creating loss of liveness for indexer verification? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/lib.rs] [Trait: RunnableConfig] [Authentication] Does the RunnableConfig implementation verify that the caller has proper credentials to access both bucket_name configurations before execution begins? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/processor.rs] [Function: init()] [Authentication bypass] Does Client::new() on line 120 properly authenticate with cloud storage, or can an unauthenticated attacker read arbitrary bucket data by manipulating environment credentials? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/processor.rs] [Function: init()] [Chain ID validation] Can an attacker bypass the chain_id validation on lines 135-140 by providing a malicious metadata.json file with matching but incorrect chain IDs in both buckets, causing wrong-chain data to be accepted? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/processor.rs] [Function: init()] [TOCTOU vulnerability] Between downloading existing_metadata (line 123-127) and new_metadata (line 128-132), can an attacker modify the metadata files in the buckets, causing a time-of-check-time-of-use race condition? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/processor.rs] [Function: init()] [Deserialization attack] Can an attacker upload a maliciously crafted metadata.json with deeply nested JSON structures causing stack overflow or excessive memory allocation during serde_json deserialization on lines 123-132? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/processor.rs] [Function: init()] [Progress file manipulation] Can an attacker who gains write access to new_bucket_name upload a malicious progress file with file_checker_version set to 0, causing the checker to restart from genesis and waste resources? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/processor.rs] [Function: init()] [Integer underflow] If an attacker sets file_checker_version in the progress file to a value less than starting_version, does the system handle this gracefully or could it cause underflow in version calculations? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/processor.rs] [Function: init()] [Chain ID mismatch detection] The validation on lines 151-156 checks progress_file.file_checker_chain_id against existing_metadata.chain_id, but can an attacker provide a progress file with a different chain_id than new_metadata to cause confusion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/processor.rs] [Function: run()] [Infinite loop DoS] Does the infinite loop starting at line 53 have any termination condition, or can it consume resources indefinitely if buckets are never updated? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/processor.rs] [Function: run()] [File name generation] Can an attacker exploit FileEntry::build_key() on line 57 to generate malicious file names that access unintended bucket paths or cause directory traversal? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/processor.rs] [Function: run()] [Resource exhaustion] When downloading files on lines 58-60, is there any size limit validation? Can an attacker upload multi-gigabyte files causing memory exhaustion? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/processor.rs] [Function: run()] [Race condition] Between checking if files exist (line 61) and downloading them (lines 58-60), can an attacker delete or modify files in the bucket, causing inconsistent state? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/processor.rs] [Function: run()] [Asymmetric file availability] If existing_file exists but new_file doesn't (lines 61-75), the checker sleeps for 30 seconds. Can an attacker repeatedly create/delete new_file to cause indefinite delay in verification? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/processor.rs] [Function: run()] [Information leakage] Does logging the bucket_name and file_name on lines 67-71 expose sensitive infrastructure information that aids attackers in targeting specific buckets? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/processor.rs] [Function: run()] [Byte comparison weakness] The byte-by-byte comparison on line 79 doesn't verify file structure - can an attacker provide corrupted but byte-identical files that will pass verification? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/processor.rs] [Function: run()] [Panic-based DoS] When files differ (lines 79-86), the system panics after 120 seconds. Can a malicious indexer operator intentionally corrupt new_bucket files to cause permanent service failure? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/processor.rs] [Function: run()] [Metrics manipulation] FILE_DIFF_COUNTER is incremented on line 82 before panicking - can an attacker trigger false alarms by temporarily modifying files during the comparison window? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/processor.rs] [Function: run()] [Version increment logic] The hardcoded increment of 1000 on line 94 assumes files are stored every 1000 versions. Can an attacker exploit gaps in version numbering to skip verification of intermediate transactions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/processor.rs] [Function: run()] [Integer overflow] When incrementing progress_file.file_checker_version by 1000 on line 94, can repeated additions cause u64 overflow near u64::MAX, wrapping to 0 and re-verifying old data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/processor.rs] [Function: run()] [Timing attack] The progress file update check on line 97 uses elapsed time - can an attacker manipulate system time to prevent progress file updates, causing state loss on crash? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/processor.rs] [Function: run()] [Progress file race condition] Between reading progress_file (line 54) and writing it (lines 103-112), can concurrent checker instances corrupt the progress state? (High)
